author: tats-u
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

You may want to create files with the newline LF in Windows.  It is inconvenient to create such files by PowerShell in Windows.  You have to run the following to do so:

```pwsh
[IO.File]::WriteAllText("$PWD\foo.txt", $ContentLines -join "`n")
```

This looks ugly.  It would be nice if `Out-File` of PowerShell supports the LF newline as it supported UTF-8 without BOM.

<!-- 
A clear and concise description of what the problem is that the new feature would solve.
Try formulating it in user story style (if applicable):
'As a user I want X so that Y.' with X being the being the action and Y being the value of the action.
-->

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

I'd like the following syntax for creating UTF-8 (w/o BOM) + LF files.

```pwsh
Out-File foo.txt -Encoding utf8NoBOM -Newline LF
```

I wish this proposed option `-Newline` takes one of the values `CRLF`, `LF`, and `Native` (or `Auto`).

P.S. `Tee-Object` may also requires this option.

comments.body:
- `Out-File` is implemented in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility/commands/utility/FormatAndOutput/out-file/Out-File.cs - An argument named `Newline` should be appended in `PathUtils.MasterStreamOpen` in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/System.Management.Automation/utils/PathUtils.cs - (for imitation) Default encoding (e.g. UTF-8) is managed in `ClrFacade.GetDefaultEncoding` in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/System.Management.Automation/utils/ClrFacade.cs - (for imitation) Choices of `-Encoding` option are managed in `encodingMap` and `ArgumentEncodingCompletionsAttribute` in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/System.Management.Automation/utils/EncodingUtils.cs Should we create a new attribute class like `ArgumentEncodingCompletionsAttribute`?
